BiblioData.Title: COATED METAL FINE PARTICLES AND PROCESS FOR PRODUCTION THEREOF
BiblioData.Abstract: A method for producing coated, fine metal particles comprising the steps of mixing powder comprising TiC or TiC and TiN with powder of an oxide of a metal M meeting the relation of G M-O > G TiO2 , wherein G M-O represents the standard free energy of formation of metal M oxide, and heat-treating the resultant mixed powder in a non-oxidizing atmosphere to reduce the oxide of the metal M with Ti, while coating the resultant metal M particles with Ti oxide, and coated, fine metal particles each comprising a metal core particle and a Ti oxide coating and having a carbon content of 0.2-1.4% by mass and a nitrogen content of 0.01-0.2% by mass.

Claims.P: 1. A method for producing coated, fine metal particles, comprising the steps of mixing powder comprising TiC or TiC and TiN with powder of an oxide of a metal M meeting the relation of [Delta]GM-O > [Delta]GTiO2, wherein [Delta]GM-O represents the standard free energy of formation of metal M oxide, and heat-treating the resultant mixed powder in a non-oxidizing atmosphere to reduce the oxide of said metal M with Ti, while coating the resultant metal M particles with Ti oxide.
2. The method for producing coated, fine metal particles according to claim 1, wherein said powder comprising TiC and TiN contains 10-50% by mass of TiN.
3. The method for producing coated, fine metal particles according to claim 1 or 2, wherein said Ti oxide is based on TiO2.
4. The method for producing coated, fine metal particles according to any one of claims 1-3, wherein said heat treatment is conducted at 650-900[deg.]C.
5. Coated, fine metal particles each comprising a metal core particle and a Ti oxide coating and having a carbon content of 0.2-1.4% by mass and a nitrogen content of 0.01-0.2% by mass.
6. The coated, fine metal particles according to claim 5, wherein the carbon content is 0.2-1.1% by mass, and the nitrogen content is 0.04-0.12% by mass.
7. The coated, fine metal particles according to claim 5 or 6, wherein the total content of carbon and nitrogen is 0.24-0.60% by mass.
8. The coated, fine metal particles according to any one of claims 5-7, wherein said metal comprises at least one element selected from the group consisting of Fe, Co and Ni.
9. The coated, fine metal particles according to any one of claims 5-8, wherein said metal comprises Fe.

10. The coated, fine metal particles according to claim 9, wherein the Fe content is 14-20 atomic % in the quantitative analysis of O, Ti and Fe by X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy, the ratio of metal Fe being 7-11% of the entire Fe.

11. The coated, fine metal particles according to claim 9 or 10, wherein when 25 mg of said coated, fine metal particles are immersed in 1 mL of an aqueous solution of guanidine hydrochloride having a concentration of 6 M at 25[deg.]C for 24 hours, the amount of Fe ions eluted is 50 mg/L or less.
12. The coated, fine metal particles according to any one of claims 5-11, which are treated with an alkali.
13. The coated, fine metal particles according to any one of claims 5-12, which are coated with silicon oxide.

14. The coated, fine metal particles according to any one of claims 5-13, onto which at least one selected from the group consisting of an amino group, a carboxyl group, an aldehyde group, a thiol group, a tosic group and a hydroxyl group is fixed.
15. The coated, fine metal particles according to any one of claims 5-14, onto which a ligand is fixed.
16. The coated, fine metal particles according to any one of claims 5-15, which are further coated with a blocking agent.
